item.title: Beginnings
item.description: Every initiative has to start somewhere, and this post is where this particular initiative starts. We are still creating the website, getting everything ready, and attempting to lay a foundation for a vibrant and exciting scholarly community going forwards. So bear with us – and we’ll see you soon.

item.title: About the Network
item.description: The daily management of the Data Protection Law Scholars Network is currently led by the following the Steering Committee. Gloria González Fuster, Research Professor, Vrije Universiteit Brussel Jef Ausloos, Postdoctoral Researcher, Universiteit van Amsterdam Kristina Irion, Assistant Professor, Universiteit van Amsterdam Eleni Kosta, Professor of Technology Law and Human Rights, Tilburg University Lee A Bygrave, Professor, University of Oslo Franziska Boehm, Professor, Leibniz-Institute for Information Infrastructure in Karlsruhe (FIZ) and the Karlsruhe Institute for Technologies (KIT) Orla Lynskey, Associate Professor, London School of Economics Michael Veale, Lecturer in Digital Rights and Regulation, University College London The steering committee is assisted in the day-to-day running of the network by further volunteers, who we will add below.
